taxonomy.description: The source organism shall be specified by genus and species (e.g., Mus musculus). The terms should come from an appropriate standard such as the NCBI taxonomy database [12]. Taxonomy information should also contain the type of subspecies and organism strain, if applicable. A standard taxonomy may be extended or a proprietary taxonomy may be used, especially if detailed identification is relevant and beyond the scope of standard taxonomies.

treatment.description: All source organism treatments shall be described (e.g., treatment with cyclooxygenase-2 (COX-2) inhibitor).

gender.description: The gender shall be provided if applicable for the particular organism.

age.description: The age shall be provided if applicable for the particular organism (e.g., 6 weeks). It may also include the developmental state (e.g., Theiler stage 23).

genotype.description: Appropriate genotype characteristics shall be described (e.g., p53-/-).

phenotype.description: Appropriate phenotype characteristics such as disease state shall be described (e.g., increased tumorigenesis).

other.description: Additional information about the source organism should be provided if relevant. This may include anatomic location of the source, visit time/date, or additional details and comments.

primary_contact_schema.json.title: MIFlowCyt Primary Contact
primary_contact_schema.json.description: The description may include information for additional individuals involved in the experiment, including their contact details and their role.

light_source_instrument_schema.json.title: MIFlowCyt Light Source Instrument

powerAtExcitatoryWavelength.description: The power of the light source shall be provided (e.g., 180 mW, 50 mW). If possible, this should be measured at the intersection of the light source beam with particles; see also 3.3.3.

polarization.description: Polarization shall be specified (e.g., linear, >100:1, in the direction of the sample flow). If possible, this should be specified at the intersection of the light source beam and particles; see also 3.3.3.

type.description: The type of the light source shall be provided (e.g., laser, diode laser, xenon lamp).

other.description: Additional relevant light source details should be provided and may include light source manufacturer name (e.g., MIFlowCyt Lasers, Inc.), light source model name (e.g., 302C Krypton-Ion Laser), light source part number (e.g., I-326), noise (e.g., <1%), pointing and power stability (e.g., <1% over 1 hour), etc.

beam.description: Light source beam dimensions and geometry shall be specified at the flow cell or at the intersection of the beam with particles (e.g., elliptical 22 x 66 μm).

excitatoryWavelength.description: The excitatory wavelength shall be provided (e.g., 488nm, 633 nm).

light_source_instrument_schema.json.description: The following details shall be specified about instruments used to analyze samples. It is expected that this information will be automatically provided by flow cytometry instruments in instrumentation description files along with list-mode data files, such as FCS files [18]. For instrument components that are not user configurable and that are part of a standard model, the instrument manufacturer and model number shall be sufficient if this uniquely specifies the required information. For all other cases where the make and model number is not sufficient to specify the required information, the individual component description shall be specified as described below..

primaryContact.description: The individual who is the primary contact for this experiment.

other.description: Additional information about the experiment should be provided if relevant. This may include funding announcements, related publications (which should be referenced by PMID), URIs, databases, etc.

qualityControlMeasures.description: A description of the quality control measures used such as replicates, calibrations, control assays, etc. shall be provided. If another experiment was performed for the purposes of establishing quality control standards, that experiment may be referenced.

conclusions.description: A brief summary of the interpretation of the results or outcome of the experiment shall be provided if available.

purpose.description: A brief description of the goal of the experiment. This should include the rationale and hypothesis.

experimentVariables.description: Variables are attribute(s) that differ between samples within an experiment due to pre-existing differences in sample states or due to experimental manipulation of the samples. If applicable, a brief description of the conditional and/or manipulated variables in the experiment shall be provided (e.g., smoker vs. nonsmoker, IL-2 treatment vs. no treatment, knockout versus wild-type, varying number of transplanted cells, varying treatment dosage, etc.). The number of instances per experimental group should also be stated.

keywords.description: The keywords should include terms from an appropriate vocabulary (e.g. MeSH) to describe the experiment.

date.description: The date or time period during which the investigation was performed (i.e., from collecting and treating samples to performing data analysis) shall be stated.

sampleLocation.description: The location of the sample origin shall be specified. This should include longitude and latitude if relevant.

sampleDescription.description: A description about the environmental sample shall be provided. The description should include relevant details such as collection time/date, collection protocol, type of sample (e.g., seawater), etc.

sample_schema.json.title: MIFlowCyt Flow Sample schema

sampleTreatmentsDescription.description: The description shall include details about treatment agents, which play the role of experiment variables, or shall specify that samples were untreated. For example, a sample treated with an agent might be compared to an untreated sample; when reproducing and interpreting such an experiment, having access to details on treatment agents and conditions is essential in order to query and retrieve samples for further analysis. The treatment description should also contain other relevant treatment details such as, but not limited to, time, temperature, and concentration.

fluorescentReagentsDescription.description: The expected and possible types of cells or other particles in the sample material, and their expected and possible measurable characteristics should be noted as these represent the key information for choosing appropriate reagents with respect to the experimental goal. The following information shall be provided about each fluorescence reagent used. Information about the characteristic(s) being measured, as well as details about what plays the role of analyte, analyte detector, and analyte reporter should be descriptive enough to allow for accurate interpretation of the experiment data. Table 1 lists some examples of reagent descriptions.

oneOf.description: A description of the sample shall be provided. The description shall include information about the nature of the material in the sample (e.g., dyed plastic beads).

materialDescription.description: Sample materials shall be described according to 2.1.1, 2.1.2, or 2.1.3, based on the type of the sample material. Each sample shall be distinguished from other samples within the same experiment.

sampleCharacteristics.description: Key information about the possible and expected sample characteristics should be noted as they provide the rationale for the experimental design, including the choice of appropriate reagents. Sample characteristics description should include the expected and possible types of cells or other particles in the sample material.

sample_schema.json.description: The flow sample details shall include a description of each sample material used in the experiment (2.1), (2.2), how they were treated (2.3) and what reagents were used (2.4) to fluorescently label the material. Relations between samples, aliquots, different treatments, and replicates shall be unambiguously described.

instrument_schema.json.title: MIFlowCyt Instrument

model.description: The instrument model shall be specified (e.g., CytMeter Elite-2000). It may include the instrument serial number.

lightSources.description: Each light source (e.g., laser) shall be described stating the following:

configurationAndSettings.description: The system and its configurations have significant impact on experimental results and as such the following shall be provided

other.description: Additional relevant instrument details should be provided and may include machine-specific information such as information about automated agitation, temperature control, controlled volume dispensing, sampling from microtiter plates, auto-boost, auto-flush, etc. Other custom settings shall be provided if relevant and may include setting name, description, and value.

manufacturer.description: The instrument manufacturer shall be specified by stating its name (e.g., MIFlowCyt Cytometry Systems, Inc.). A URL pointing to manufacturer web pages may also be provided.

instrument_schema.json.description: The following details shall be specified about instruments used to analyze samples. It is expected that this information will be automatically provided by flow cytometry instruments in instrumentation description files along with list-mode data files, such as FCS files [18]. For instrument components that are not user configurable and that are part of a standard model, the instrument manufacturer and model number shall be sufficient if this uniquely specifies the required information. For all other cases where the make and model number is not sufficient to specify the required information, the individual component description shall be specified as described below.

listModeDataFile.description: The list-mode data files (e.g., FCS files [18]) shall be provided directly or details on how they may be requested shall be stated.

miflowcyt_schema.json.title: MIFlowCyt (Minimum Information about a Flow Cytometry Experiment) main schema

flowSampleDetails.description: The flow sample details shall include a description of each sample material used in the experiment (2.1), (2.2), how they were treated (2.3) and what reagents were used (2.4) to fluorescently label the material. Relations between samples, aliquots, different treatments, and replicates shall be unambiguously described.

dataAnalysis.description: Information about the data analysis performed.

instrumentDetails.description: The following details shall be specified about instruments used to analyze samples. It is expected that this information will be automatically provided by flow cytometry instruments in instrumentation description files along with list-mode data files, such as FCS files [18]. For instrument components that are not user configurable and that are part of a standard model, the instrument manufacturer and model number shall be sufficient if this uniquely specifies the required information. For all other cases where the make and model number is not sufficient to specify the required information, the individual component description shall be specified as described below.

miflowcyt_schema.json.description: The main JSON-schema representing MIFlowCyt reporting guideline.

flow_cell_schema.json.title: MIFlowCyt Flow Cell

other.description: Other relevant flow cell details should be provided and may include flow cell manufacturer name (e.g., MIFlowCyt Optics, Inc.) and model number (e.g., PRO-CFC-75), flow cell outside shape (e.g., rectangular with an attached sphere, spherical, square) and dimensions, flow channel shape (e.g., rectangular, circular, triangular) and dimensions, sheath flow velocity (e.g., 10 l/s), sheath flow pump type (e.g., gas pressure, vacuum, gear), sample flow velocity (e.g., 7.5 l/s) and sample flow pump (e.g., gas pressure, syringe).

flowCellType.description: The flow cell type (e.g., stream-in-air, cuvette) including the material shall be provided.

flow_cell_schema.json.description: The flow cell of the instrument

sourceDescription.description: The source of the biological sample shall be described (e.g., wild- type mouse, C57BL/6 spleen, C57BL/6 splenocytes). If the source is a cell line the description shall include its name, ATCC [17] (or equivalent) number, and cell type.

sampleDescription.description: A description of the biological sample shall be provided, including the sample type, if relevant (e.g., C57BL/6 spleen, purified CD4+ lymphocytes, BALB/c thymocyte DNA, control patient PBMCs, protein lysate from lung cancer biopsy, peripheral blood from patient with Type I diabetes, liver biopsy, etc.)

other.description: Additional information about the biological sample should be provided if relevant. This may include relevant information such as in vivo or in vitro treatment, stimulation, preparation / enrichment protocol, culture/growth protocol, collection time/date, whether the sample was frozen/banked/fixed, etc.

organism.description: The source organism for this biological sample

fluorescence_reagent_schema.json.title: MIFlowCyt Fluorescence Reagent

cloneNameOrNumber.description: If the probe is a monoclonal antibody, the clone name or number shall be provided.

analyteDetector.description: What plays the role of analyte detector? Which component of the fluorescence reagent specifically binds to the analyte to make it detectable (e.g., anti-CD25 antibody)?

analyteReporter.description: (Fluorochrome) What plays the role of analyte reporter? Which component of the fluorescence reagent reports the presents of the analyte to the flow cytometer? What substance (label) is used to generate the measured signal (e.g., FITC)?

other.description: When secondary antibodies are used, the primary analyte (the analyte bound by the primary antibody) and the reporter component of the secondary antibody (the reporter that generates the measured signal) shall be clearly specified as described in 2.4.2, 2.4.3, and 2.4.4. If relevant, the primary and secondary antibodies shall be described individually (e.g., in the case that the use of a secondary antibody significantly impacts the interpretation of results because of nonspecific fluorescence, etc.). The description should also contain other relevant details which may include lot number, concentration, label incorporation method, separation technique, antibody staining procedures, and wash steps.

characteristicsBeingMeasured.description: The relative amount of molecules, properties, or processes being evaluated (e.g., CD25, apoptosis, membrane permeability, cell viability, oxidative burst). The characteristic(s) being measured shall be provided whenever there is ambiguity about the analyte being measured, such as when sample processing affects detection of the analyte (e.g., propidium iodide example in Table 1). The optical detector (e.g., FL1) or parameter (e.g., FL1-H, see 3.3.6) used primarily for this measurement shall be indicated.

reagentManufacturerName.description: The reagent manufacturer shall be specified (e.g., MIFlowCyt Reagent Inc.).

analyte.description: What plays the role of the analyte? Which substance or chemical constituent is the subject of interest of the analytical procedure, what target is specifically bound by the analyte detector (e.g., CD25)?

reagentCatalogueNumber.description: The reagent catalogue number shall be specified.

fluorescence_reagent_schema.json.description: The expected and possible types of cells or other particles in the sample material, and their expected and possible measurable characteristics should be noted as these represent the key information for choosing appropriate reagents with respect to the experimental goal. The following information shall be provided about each fluorescence reagent used. Information about the characteristic(s) being measured, as well as details about what plays the role of analyte, analyte detector, and analyte reporter should be descriptive enough to allow for accurate interpretation of the experiment data. Table 1 lists some examples of reagent descriptions.

assay_schema.json.title: MIACME assay schema

cellInput.description: The manner in which the cell population is presented at the start of the assay

assay_schema.json.description: JSON-schema representing the cell model in a cell migration experiment.

pixel_schema.json.title: MIACME pixel schema. A picture element. Based on OME Pixel: https://www.openmicroscopy.org/Schemas/Documentation/Generated/OME-2016-06/ome_xsd.html#Pixels

physicalSizeZ.description: The physical size of the pixel in the depth dimension.

physicalSizeX.description: The physical size of the pixel in the width dimension.

sizeZ.description: The range one picture element in the image spans in the depth dimension.

sizeY.description: The range one picture element in the image spans in the height dimension.

physicalSizeXUnit.description: The unit of the physical size of the pixel in the width dimension.

physicalSizeYUnit.description: The unit of the physical size of the pixel in the height dimension.

physicalSizeY.description: The physical size of the pixel in the height dimension.

identifier.description: An identifier for the picture element.

sizeC.description: The number of channels of the picture element.

sizeX.description: The range one picture element in the image spans in the width dimension.

physicalSizeZUnit.description: The unit of the physical size of the pixel in the depth dimension.

pixel_schema.json.description: JSON-schema representing a pixel in MIACME

organization_schema.json.title: MIACME organization schema

identifierSource.description: Information about the organisation or namespace responsible for minting the identifier.

organization_schema.json.description: JSON-schema representing an organization in MIACME. Legal or physical entity corresponding to a business or administration

investigation_schema.json.title: MIACME investigation schema

acknowledges.description: The grant(s) which funded and supported the investigation.

MIACMEversion.description: The version of MIACME this dataset description should be compliant with.

contacts.description: The person(s) who contributed to the investigation, such as the Principal Investigator, corresponding author in related publications or other researchers involved.

MIACMEcompliance.description: The result of the validation for MIACME compliance.

studies.description: The studies associated with the Investigation.

identifier.description: Primary identifier for the investigation. Ideally, a persistent identifier but an internal user identifier at a minimum.

identifierSource.description: Information about the organisation or namespace responsible for creating and maintaining the identifier.

publications.description: Scholarly articles associated with the investigation, usually describing the methods applied and conclusions reached by the investigation.

conclusions.description: A set of statements summarizing the findings of the investigation. It could be a URI referring to a nanopublication.

description.description: A textual narrative comprised of one or more statements about the investigation.

investigation_schema.json.description: JSON-schema representing an investigation in MIACME. A planned activity that involves one or more studies.

person_schema.json.title: MIACME person schema. A human being.

roles.description: The roles assumed by the person. Ideally from a controlled vocabulary or ontology.

identifier.description: A persistent identifier of the person, it should be an ORCID.

identifierSource.description: Information about the organisation or namespace responsible for creating and maintaining the identifier.

affiliation.description: The organizations to which the person is associated with.

person_schema.json.description: JSON-schema representing a person in MIACME

date_schema.json.title: MIACME date schema

type.description: The type of date, used to specify the process which is being timestamped by the date attribute value, ideally comes from a controlled terminology.

date.description: A date following the ISO8601 standard.

date_schema.json.description: Information about a calendar date or timestamp indicating day, month, year and time of an event.

imaging_condition_schema.json.title: MIACME imaging condition schema

objectiveLens.description: Objective manufacturer and objective acronym specifying optical correction, primary use of microscopy method and magnification (may also include immersion medium and/or working distance or field of view)

modality.description: The type of microscopy used to acquire images. For example: confocal, microscopy, spinning disk, wide-field, multi-phonon, light-sheet, super-resolution,

timeSeriesIntervalUnit.description: The unit of the time series interval.

pixels.description: The physical dimension of one picture element in your image.

numericalAperture.description:
Value that indicates the light acceptance angle of the objective (
determines the light gathering power, resolving power, and depth of 
field of the objective).

channelDefinition.description: Identification of the label or constrasts

imageSequenceType.description: Single or multiple imaging timepoints in the experiment.

timeSeriesInterval.description: The duration between two sequential frames of the time lapse series.

observationPeriodUnit.description: The unit of the observation period.

observationPeriod.description: For time-series, it is the timespan since the imaging process starts until it ends. For endpoint, it is the timespan since the starting point until the image is taken.

imaging_condition_schema.json.description: JSON-schema representing an investigation in MIACME

study_schema.json.title: MIACME study schema

acknowledges.description: The grant(s) which funded and supported the investigation.

experimental_setup.description: Set of properties that in combination describe the experiment or experiments in the study.

MIACMEversion.description: The version of MIACME this dataset description should be compliant with.

contacts.description: The person(s) which contributed to the study, such as the Principal Investigator/corresponding author in publications or other researchers involved.

conclusions.description: A set of statements summarizing the findings of the study. It could be a URI referring to a nanopublication.

title.description: A short sentence naming the study.

identifier.description: Primary identifier for the study or experiment.

identifierSource.description: Information about the organisation or namespace responsible for creating and maintaining the identifier.

publications.description: Scholarly articles associated with the investigation, usually describing the methods applied and conclusions reached by the investigation.

description.description: A textual narrative comprised of one or more statements about the study.

data.description: The data generated in this study.

MIACMEcompliance.description: The result of the validation for MIACME compliance.

study_schema.json.description: JSON-schema representing a study in MIACME. A planned activity that consists on study planning, study design execution,  documentation and which produces conclusion(s).

data_schema.json.title: MIACME data schema
data_schema.json.description: JSON-schema representing an investigation in MIACME

experimental_setup_schema.json.title: MIACME experimental setup schema

microEnvironment.description: The nature or components of the material surrounding/contacting the cells for which migration is tested, including substrate, ECM protein or synthetic counterpart, tissue, other cells or entire organism.

basicApproach.description: A description of the study type or approach used, such as in vitro, in vivo, in silico.

treatment.description: The manipulation/perturbation of which the (migratory) effect is being tested.

cellModel.description: A description of the cells used in the experiment.

assay.description: The migration/invasion assay for this investigation, and its specifications.

medium.description: Solution used to provide nutritives and motility-assisting additives to migrating cells

organism.description: The organism corresponding to the microEnvironment, if it is a tissue.

experimental_setup_schema.json.description: JSON-schema representing the experimental setup in a cell migration experiment.

identifier.description: A persistent identifier for the publication, it should be a DOI or pubmed identifier

identifierSource.description: Information about the organisation or namespace responsible for minting the identifier.

publicationVenue.description: The venue where the publication appears (journal, publishing platform etc).

grant_schema.json.title: MIACME grant schema

identifierSource.description: Information about the organisation or namespace responsible for creating and maintaining the identifier.

funders.description: The person(s) or organization(s) which has awarded the funds supporting the project.

name.description: The name of the grant and its funding program.

grant_schema.json.description: An allocated sum of funds given by a government or other organization for a particular purpose.

annotation_schema.json.title: MIACME annotation schema

value.description: The value of the annotation - it can be a string or a number (for coded values).

valueIRI.description: The IRI of a concept or ontology term associated with the value. It can also be an empty string

annotation_schema.json.description: A pair of value (string or numeric) with a corresponding ontology term (IRI), if applicable.

cell_model_schema.json.title: MIACME cell model schema

cellType.description: The type of cell used in the experiment. For example: cell line, primary cell, endogenous cell.

specificCellDetails.description: The specific details about the cell.

organism.description: The organism of origin of the cell.

cell_model_schema.json.description: JSON-schema representing the cell model in a cell migration experiment.
